intro: Reseda luteola subsp. luteola, commonly known as yellow weed or lesser reseda, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring erect, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in disturbed soils and is commonly found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
